text_block_list.text:
My mind dwells only on Manhattan<n>Cafe's immense ability.
I decide to<n>make my nightly sojourn to the track<n>once
more, when...
Bzzt.
The lights in my office go out.

It saves me the trouble of having to<n>hit all the switches
myself at least. I<n>leave the pitch-black room behind.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Pant, pant... Once more, and thistime...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: This time... I'll catch up to you...

It appears that she is running after<n>that "friend" of hers this
evening as<n>well.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Tch... So far...

Unlike before, though, her steps are<n>erratic. Maybe she's
too fixated on<n>catching up to her "friend" to maintain<n>a
stable pace...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Pant, pant, pant... I'm still... notthere...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Oh.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Good evening.
choice_data_list:
I know this is sudden, but if it's not too much
trouble...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Huh?
choice_data_list: Can you tell me about how your friend runs?

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: But... why? ...You can't even...

I can't see her. But it's for that very<n>reason that I want to
know more.<n>What style is she using? When does<n>she
make for the finish line?

If I knew what kind of technique her<n>rival was employing,
then I'd be able<n>to offer her some advice. She's trying<n>so
hard. I really want to do what I can<n>for her...
choice_data_list:
It may be none of my business, but I'd like to
help.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: My friend is... very fast...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Yes.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...Yes.

Something tells me she's not too<n>keen on opening up about
this.

For the next few evenings, I make it a<n>habit to visit the
training course.

Something strange happens every<n>time. Books falling off
shelves, or the<n>TV seemingly turning itself on... I even<n>
encounter a jammed door once<n>more...
choice_data_list: I've gotten used to it, though!

text_block_list.text:
Luckily, Manhattan Cafe seems to be<n>getting used to my
visits as well.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Um... She's a bit wild today... Like<n>she's really motivated.

Though she is still a bit apprehensive,<n>she shares a little
more about her<n>friend with me on each passing night.

text_block_list.name: New Trainer A
text_block_list.text:
I'm really not having much luck with<n>this whole scouting
thing. How about<n>you?

My evenings spent with Manhattan<n>Cafe have all served to
make me<n>want to be her trainer.

The only catch is—I can't see her<n>friend, and I don't know if
that'll be a<n>deal-breaker.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: I got some good advice yesterday...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text:
That trainer... probably thinks I'm<n>strange. And the advice
might just be<n>an excuse to watch...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ...But... if I'm being honest...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: I feel like... even by a little bit... just a<n>little bit...

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: I've... been able to close the distance<n>between us.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: ... Maybe... I can count on a visit...<n>tonight as well.

I fully intend to watch her train this<n>evening, but I can't help
but wonder if<n>I'm starting to become a nuisance.
Clack.
The door opens without issue...

But I feel as if I'm dragged through it<n>by some immense
force.
I quickly brush it off and make for the<n>track.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Good evening. You're here... a bit<n>earlier than usual...
I can sense a hint of relief in her<n>voice.

The next day, I go out in search of<n>Manhattan Cafe at the
courses once<n>again. I'm greeted by a different face<n>
instead.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Oho, searching for Cafe, are we?<n>You're not like most of the
other<n>trainers, then.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Hehe. Why don't you come with me<n>instead? Your
mannerisms fascinate<n>me.

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: Isn't that...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Welcome to my laboratory!<n>Impressive, is it not? Oh, and the
other<n>half is Cafe's space.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I would urge you not to touch<n>anything over there. I
rummaged<n>through her articles once, and the<n>amount of
research material that<n>spontaneously combusted in the<n>
aftermath was enough to bring me to<n>tears.

What a strange space. Though I can<n>observe it with my own
eyes, it feels<n>as if it lies within a separate<n>dimension
entirely.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Perhaps if I were a psychologist, I<n>would be more keen on
unraveling its<n>mysteries.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Tell me, though. What do you think of<n>this "friend" that Cafe
is always<n>speaking of? Do you believe she<n>exists?
choice_data_list: Yes, because Cafe says she does.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I see. "Existence" itself begs<n>definition, but setting that
aside—you<n>trust in that which neither you nor I,<n>nor anyone
else can physically<n>observe.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Not very scientific of you, I must say.<n>What gives you such
confidence?

Merely shifting your position can<n>change your field of view.
Surely it<n>follows that things can exist outside<n>our
perception, visible only to another.

Thinking this argument to be ironclad,<n>I express it to Agnes
Tachyon...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Ahahahaha! Wonderful! Even I<n>cannot deny that there is a
plethora of<n>possibilities yet unknown!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Hehehe. I trust now that you won't<n>be a waste of my time.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I'm feeling quite invigorated indeed.<n>Come, let me prepare
you some tea.<n>What? Don't fuss over the<n>incandescent
glow!

text_block_list.name: Manhattan Cafe
text_block_list.text: So even without seeing my friend,<n>that trainer...
